ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I improved my reading, writing, and conversational skills
How to read, write, and speak elementary level Chinese.
Through this course I learned a lot of fundamental Chinese characters and speaking skills.
I developed insight into elementary Chinese, learning a lot of characters, grammar rules, and conversational words.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments:
Strengths: Small seminar setting, teacher got to know us personally, assignments and readings were helpful to cement new Chinese characters
Weaknesses: None

Strengths were that the course was very well organized, the pre-planned calendar was especially useful, and that the professor was very engaged in our learning.
No weaknesses.

I do not believe that this course be improved, I thought it was very well organized. I thought that the course gave an appropriate amount of homework and I thought that the pacing of the class was great.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes, if they are looking to improve their reading and writing skills. Chinese class is a great way to meet other students
Yes. Especially to heritage speakers, this is an exceptional way to facilitate learning Chinese. Information is given as needed and the course is very organized.

Yes, I believe that if you are a heritage speaker at L1, this is a crucial class, not just for the language requirement but if you are already able to speak the language, why not learn how to read and write?
Yes, If you are a person who came from speaking Chinese at home, but didn't know how to read or write, this is a good course.
